signature_matches.name: get common file path
signature_matches.rule_src:
rule:
  meta:
    name: get common file path
    namespace: host-interaction/file-system
    authors:
      - moritz.raabe@mandiant.com
      - michael.hunhoff@mandiant.com
      - anushka.virgaonkar@mandiant.com
    scopes:
      static: function
      dynamic: call
    att&ck:
      - Discovery::File and Directory Discovery [T1083]
    mbc:
      - Discovery::File and Directory Discovery [E1083]
    examples:
      - Practical Malware Analysis Lab 03-02.dll_:0x10003415
      - 972B219F18379907A045431303F4DA7D:0x404887
  features:
    - or:
      - api: kernel32.GetTempPath
      - api: kernel32.GetTempFileName
      - api: kernel32.GetSystemDirectory
      - api: kernel32.GetWindowsDirectory
      - api: kernel32.GetSystemWow64Directory
      - api: GetAllUsersProfileDirectory
      - api: GetAppContainerFolderPath
      - api: GetCurrentDirectory
      - api: GetDefaultUserProfileDirectory
      - api: GetProfilesDirectory
      - api: GetUserProfileDirectory
      - api: SHGetFolderPathAndSubDir
      - api: shell32.SHGetFolderPath
      - api: shell32.SHGetFolderLocation
      - api: shell32.SHGetKnownFolderPath
      - api: shell32.SHGetSpecialFolderPath
      - api: shell32.SHGetSpecialFolderLocation
      - api: System.IO.Directory::GetCurrentDirectory
      - api: System.Environment::GetFolderPath
      - property/read: System.Environment::SystemDirectory
      - property/read: System.Environment::CurrentDirectory

signature_matches.name: open clipboard
signature_matches.rule_src:
rule:
  meta:
    name: open clipboard
    namespace: host-interaction/clipboard
    authors:
      - michael.hunhoff@mandiant.com
    scopes:
      static: function
      dynamic: span of calls
    att&ck:
      - Collection::Clipboard Data [T1115]
    examples:
      - 6f99a2c8944cb02ff28c6f9ced59b161:0x403180
  features:
    - and:
      - api: user32.OpenClipboard
      - optional:
        - api: user32.CloseClipboard

signature_matches.name: read .ini file
signature_matches.rule_src:
rule:
  meta:
    name: read .ini file
    namespace: host-interaction/file-system/read
    authors:
      - "@_re_fox"
      - michael.hunhoff@mandiant.com
    scopes:
      static: function
      dynamic: span of calls
    mbc:
      - File System::Read File [C0051]
    examples:
      - 1d8fd13c890060464019c0f07b928b1a:0x401070
      - E6234FB98F17201C232F4502015B47B3:0x701312FA
  features:
    - and:
      - or:
        - api: GetPrivateProfileInt
        - api: GetPrivateProfileString
        - api: GetPrivateProfileStruct
        - api: GetPrivateProfileSection
        - api: GetPrivateProfileSectionNames
      - optional:
        - string: /\.ini/i
        - api: GetFullPathName

signature_matches.name: create process on Windows
signature_matches.rule_src:
rule:
  meta:
    name: create process on Windows
    namespace: host-interaction/process/create
    authors:
      - moritz.raabe@mandiant.com
    scopes:
      static: basic block
      dynamic: call
    mbc:
      - Process::Create Process [C0017]
    examples:
      - 9324D1A8AE37A36AE560C37448C9705A:0x406DB0
      - Practical Malware Analysis Lab 01-04.exe_:0x4011FC
      - 692f7fd6d198e804d6af98eb9e390d61:0x6000003
  features:
    - or:
      - api: kernel32.WinExec
      - api: kernel32.CreateProcess
      - api: shell32.ShellExecute
      - api: shell32.ShellExecuteEx
      - api: advapi32.CreateProcessAsUser
      - api: advapi32.CreateProcessWithLogon
      - api: advapi32.CreateProcessWithToken
      - api: kernel32.CreateProcessInternal
      - api: ntdll.NtCreateUserProcess
      - api: ntdll.NtCreateProcess
      - api: ntdll.NtCreateProcessEx
      - api: ntdll.ZwCreateProcess
      - api: ZwCreateProcessEx
      - api: ntdll.ZwCreateUserProcess
      - api: ntdll.RtlCreateUserProcess
      - api: System.Diagnostics.Process::Start

signature_matches.name: get graphical window text
signature_matches.rule_src:
rule:
  meta:
    name: get graphical window text
    namespace: host-interaction/gui/window/get-text
    authors:
      - moritz.raabe@mandiant.com
    scopes:
      static: function
      dynamic: span of calls
    mbc:
      - Discovery::Application Window Discovery [E1010]
    examples:
      - B7841B9D5DC1F511A93CC7576672EC0C:0x10007A50
      - Practical Malware Analysis Lab 11-03.dll_:0x10001000
  features:
    - or:
      - and:
        - optional:
          - api: user32.IsWindowVisible
        - or:
          - basic block:
            - and:
              - number: 0xD = WM_GETTEXT
              - api: user32.SendMessage
          - call:
            - and:
              - number: 0xD = WM_GETTEXT
              - api: user32.SendMessage
      - and:
        - optional:
          - api: user32.GetForegroundWindow
        - api: user32.GetWindowText

signature_matches.name: set current directory
signature_matches.rule_src:
rule:
  meta:
    name: set current directory
    namespace: host-interaction/file-system
    authors:
      - michael.hunhoff@mandiant.com
    scopes:
      static: function
      dynamic: call
  features:
    - or:
      - api: System.IO.Directory::SetCurrentDirectory
      - api: kernel32.SetCurrentDirectory
      - api: chdir
      - api: fchdir

signature_matches.name: read clipboard data
signature_matches.rule_src:
rule:
  meta:
    name: read clipboard data
    namespace: host-interaction/clipboard
    authors:
      - michael.hunhoff@mandiant.com
      - anushka.virgaonkar@mandiant.com
    scopes:
      static: function
      dynamic: span of calls
    att&ck:
      - Collection::Clipboard Data [T1115]
    references:
      - https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/dataxchg/using-the-clipboard
    examples:
      - C91887D861D9BD4A5872249B641BC9F9:0x40156F
      - 93dfc146f60bd796eb28d4e4f348f2e4:0x401050
  features:
    - and:
      - optional:
        - match: open clipboard
        - match: contain loop
        - api: kernel32.GlobalAlloc
        - api: kernel32.GlobalLock
        - api: kernel32.GlobalUnlock
      - or:
        - basic block:
          - and:
            - api: user32.GetClipboardData
            - optional:
              - number: 0x1 = CF_TEXT
              - number: 0x7 = CF_OEMTEXT
              - number: 0xD = CF_UNICODETEXT
        - call:
          - and:
            - api: user32.GetClipboardData
            - optional:
              - number: 0x1 = CF_TEXT
              - number: 0x7 = CF_OEMTEXT
              - number: 0xD = CF_UNICODETEXT
        - api: System.Windows.Forms.Clipboard::GetAudioStream
        - api: System.Windows.Forms.Clipboard::GetData
        - api: System.Windows.Forms.Clipboard::GetDataObject
        - api: System.Windows.Forms.Clipboard::GetFileDropList
        - api: System.Windows.Forms.Clipboard::GetImage
        - api: System.Windows.Forms.Clipboard::GetText

signature_matches.name: stealth_network
signature_matches.description: Network activity detected but not expressed in monitor API logs

signature_matches.name: stealth_timeout
signature_matches.description: Possible date expiration check, exits too soon after checking local time

signature_matches.name: encrypted_ioc
signature_matches.description: At least one IP Address, Domain, or File Name was found in a crypto call

signature_matches.name: resumethread_remote_process
signature_matches.description: Resumed a thread in another process
match_data: {"thread_resumed": "Process rundll32.exe with process ID 3564 resumed a thread in another process with the process ID 2296"}
{"thread_resumed": "Process werfault.exe with process ID 2296 resumed a thread in another process with the process ID 3564"}

signature_matches.name: createtoolhelp32snapshot_module_enumeration
signature_matches.description: Enumerates the modules from a process (may be used to locate base addresses in process injection)

signature_matches.name: antivm_generic_system
signature_matches.description: Checks the system manufacturer, likely for anti-virtualization

signature_matches.name: procmem_yara
signature_matches.description: Yara detections observed in process dumps, payloads or dropped files
match_data: {"Hit": "PID 3564 triggered the Yara rule 'shellcode_get_eip' with data '['{ E8 00 00 00 00 58 }']'"}
{"Hit": "PID 2296 triggered the Yara rule 'shellcode_get_eip' with data '['{ E8 00 00 00 00 58 }']'"}

signature_matches.name: static_pe_anomaly
match_data: {"anomaly": "Entrypoint of binary is located outside of any mapped sections"}

signature_matches.name: antivm_generic_disk
signature_matches.description: Queries information on disks, possibly for anti-virtualization

mitre_attack_techniques.signature_description: An adversary may attempt to get detailed information about the operating system and hardware, including version, patches, hotfixes, service packs, and architecture.
Adversaries may employ various means to detect and avoid virtualization and analysis environments.
Adversaries may attempt to get information about running processes on a system.
Adversaries may interact with the Windows Registry to gather information about the system, configuration, and installed software.
Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols to avoid detection/network filtering by blending in with existing traffic.
Adversaries may inject code into processes in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges.
Creates a process in suspended mode (likely to inject code)
Runs a DLL by calling functions
Checks if the current process is being debugged
Creates a DirectInput object (often for capturing keystrokes)
Checks if the current process is being debugged
Queries the volume information (name, serial number etc) of a device

Queries the volume information (name, serial number etc) of a device

T1497.description: Adversaries may employ various means to detect and avoid virtualization and analysis environments.
Checks if the current process is being debugged

T1057.description: Adversaries may attempt to get information about running processes on a system.

T1012.description: Adversaries may interact with the Windows Registry to gather information about the system, configuration, and installed software.

T1071.description: Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols to avoid detection/network filtering by blending in with existing traffic.

T1055.description: Adversaries may inject code into processes in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges.
Creates a process in suspended mode (likely to inject code)

T1218.011.description: Runs a DLL by calling functions

T1056.description: Creates a DirectInput object (often for capturing keystrokes)

T1518.001.description: Checks if the current process is being debugged
